articleBody: Tip of the day - photography basics - Creative Editing Photography Basics - Creative Editing – Ten Lessons10 ways to improve the final image - Photography Basics • The more you get right in the camera the less time you spend editing • Every correction for sloppy camera work degrades the quality of the image • The camera can only take the image so far so recognise the potential of an image with editing • Stick to your intention for the image when editing – if you don’t know, don’t edit • Tame your adjustments so they stay balanced and representative of what you want to show • Never edit or style an image according to what’s popular or seems to fit the trends • Be true to yourself and the image – no one else should judge your work more than you • Use the best tool for the job, don’t get attached to one method or toolset • Take time to edit regularly and thoroughly so you become proficient and efficient at it • Be prepared to live with a version for some time and if needs be, re-work it again.
